name: Flathead
blurb: Ambush artist that loves edges and drain mouths. Glide a soft plastic near sand ripples and try not to spook it with your… enthusiasm.

name: Bream
blurb: Picket‑pocket of the pylons. Light leaders, smelly baits. If it stinks, it links.

name: Whiting
blurb: Sand‑dwelling sugar sticks. Walk the dog lures or worms on a slow roll over the flats.

name: Tailor
blurb: Foam‑line slashers. Metals at dawn and dusk; keep your fingers and your farts clear.

name: Mulloway
blurb: The silver ghost. Loves pressure edges and low‑light tides. Patience, persistence, and perhaps a lucky waft.
